Reviews.Content: Now I get better autofocus system, and more control (low, medium, high...) on D-lighting, ISO, noise reduction, plus I get HDR (High dynamic range),build in Interval timer shooting (no need extra accesories!!) Improved video quality, stereo mic and I can move the monitor screen to get very slow,high or hard to get angles.All other things are basically a D3200

Reviews.Title: D5200 vs. D7000 vs. D70
Reviews.Author: Breb
Reviews.Content: About a year ago I went from D70 to D7000 in one gulp.  Despite all the "D7000 is a very great move" suggestions online it was a very silly idea because I could barely operate the D7000.  I tried a variety of lenses, but nothing could fix my lack of know-how. Eight wonderful D70 years did NOT prepare me for the D7k.  The fact that the d7k even HAS an Auto button is a JOKE. I had to shoot manually to get even half decent shots (although I have to say it was great for doing high speed shots of dogs leaping through the air)So a few months ago I craigslisted my D7000 - it pretty much covered a nice new D5200.The D5200 was a good move for me.  Even video became a possibility with the d5200 (quite difficult on the D7000 due to the awful fixed screen and the 24fps)The D5200 works nicely with my 50mm prime lens and with my old kit D7000 lens.  It even works well with my old D70 kit lens!!However it would seem that the skin color of pictures with the prime + D5200 seems off,bland,  and often a little overexposed.  But sometimes it's great. I have no idea, really.Anyway to sum up: good snapshots, easy to use all round.  LIGHTER than the D7k.  Good in low light. But for video? BEWARE! This isn't a camcorder!  The autofocus on my lenses in AF-F trying to track kids/dog/baby is awful. It does the best it can but the technology for a rank amateur just isn't there, and won't be anytime soon.If I could just stop the pictures from being a little too bright it would be a perfect camera for me!

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jean Taillon
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace my Nikon D5000,  Got the "body only" because I have the 2 Nikon lenses that came with my D5000 but I use the camera 90% of the time with my Tamron 18-270mm lens. Very nice combination.Was looking at the D7100 too but if think it is not worth the price difference. For my use, it is the perfect SLR. Canon makes good camera too but I am a Nikon fan. Will give 5 stars when the price comes down.

Reviews.Title: Super for starter
Reviews.Author: Sik403
Reviews.Content: Just loving this DSLR!  It's been a month I got my DSLR , this is amazing camera. If you know the options, you are the boss ! This was my first DSLR, I learnt most of the options from YouTube videos and taking few random clicks. My experience till now is mind blowing.

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction Guaranteed! An Excellent Beginners Choice
Reviews.Author: Allen
Reviews.Content: This is my first upgrade from the Nokia D3100 and the difference is astounding. If you are willing to make the jump (an extra $300 from lesser versions), you ARE getting much more! I would suggest something as good as this to any budding professional looking for great equipment under $1000. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: This camera is beautiful and works wonders. The picture is crisp and clean. It takes only like, an hour to really get the hang of it if you're not too familiar with fancy shmancy cameras. (Which I was not.) I love the motion button. It takes around 22 pictures in a row without stopping and can catch any movement. I first tried it out on my dog while she was running around. It caught every hair on her body in movement. Just wonderful. I still need to get the hang of the flash at different settings, but other than that, it's great! Oh and the video is pretty good too. Not amazing but certainly better than any phone or cheap video camera. I recommend getting it in red. The others look a little plasticy and I dunno....not professional? The red looks best in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Redwing "heyshanny"
Reviews.Content: Awesome features.  Takes amazing pictures! I would recommend to anyone who's looking to upgrade their starter DSLR.  I'm thrilled with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Cem
Reviews.Content: Don't forget to get a remote control. I had the opportunity to take pictures of the planetary alignment on May 24th. The picture came out great. It is lightweight and the grip is strong.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR and loving it!
Reviews.Author: garet821
Reviews.Content: I finally made the upgrade from a point and shoot to a DSLR. I'm very happy with it so far. I shoot a lot of video for action sports and wanted to consolidate great video capture ability with full burst mode picture stills. The video quality is great, the audio not so much. This isn't a problem as I would normally add an external mic anyway. As far as the action stills go, you can't beat it. I race and shoot pics for motocross which is very demanding on a camera to get a crisp shot. It makes it very easy for even a novice to come away with professional quality images. I haven't figured out how to work half of the stuff on this camera, so it should keep me satisfied for a long time to come.

Reviews.Title: The camera is very goof
Reviews.Author: HXX
Reviews.Content: The camera is that I want to buy first. My choose is right. It is greatly good. The price is cheap for customers.

Reviews.Title: Great  Camera, easy transaction
Reviews.Author: Daniel J Vieira
Reviews.Content: Camera is as described. An awesome camera. Entire transaction was painless and went smoothly. Definitely would recommend to anyone interested in a new camera.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME Camera!
Reviews.Author: Andy Crofton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a couple months ago and couldn't be happier! It takes stunning pictures and has outstanding functionality. You can't go wrong buying such a great camera! It's also very reasonably priced! You get a lot of bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Great Cammera!
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with this product.The delivery service was so god and all intact. Very recomendable!So, if you want to make amazing photos, you should to buy a 50 mm f/1.4 Lens.

Reviews.Title: Words cannot describe how happy I am with this
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: The subject says it all. I've been going back and forth about this camera for over a year now. I am very pleased I finally got it. It takes fantastic pictures, AND it works with all my old lenses. The catch with the old lenses is that they don't auto focus during the videos. I'll apparently need to get a new digital SLR lens that will auto focus properly for me. I want it mostly for vacation pictures and videos so I don't really need to have the absolute control over the focus when I'm taking a video

Reviews.Title: I bought this for a client
Reviews.Author: Richard Porter
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a client, so far no complaints from her, I've always bought NIKON anyway for personal use

Reviews.Title: We love this camera and it is good price too.
Reviews.Author: Doris Cho
Reviews.Content: Thank for your services. It is nice camera and we enjoy it. We will do the business with you again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Andre Araujo
Reviews.Content: Nikon D5200 is such a great camera and has a fast access to the controls without too much fiddling.All my pictures are perfect now.

Reviews.Title: excellent beginner DSLR
Reviews.Author: Rob "Combo"
Reviews.Content: Great product; love this camera.  Good beginner dslr. It can be as simple or complicated as you wish and pictures are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!  Clear and brilliant pictures
Reviews.Author: Mom to Curtis
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera; takes beautiful and clear pictures.  There are many settings and filters to learn.  I am new at using this kind of camera, but it is easy to learn without reading the entire book.  If you are looking for a great camera with many settings, filters and takes clear photos then look no further.  The only thing I wish I would have purchased at the same time was the 55-200mm lens because the 18-55mm lens (that comes with it) doesn't have any telephoto or real close up view.  I have ordered the additional lens.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Jimmy "/jimmy/"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a pro photographer -- but with a medium learning curve, this camera takes great photos.  Added a Nikkor 18-200mm lens and I'm ready to go.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Faith N
Reviews.Content: I'm no photography pro but I purchased this after playing around with my best friend's Nikon D5100. 6 months later I'm still in love. This camera is everything I wanted and more. It's true to all the specs given, I've had no issues with it so far. Hoping all my future purchases of Nikon will be just as good!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera. It was between this or the canon rebel T5i. It's not cumbersome to operate. In fact my wife is terrible with tech items and she finds it simple to use and loves it. If you have kids in sports/activities the rapid fire option is great. Beware you will take a lot of pics so make sure you have a large SD card and hard drive. We also bought the extra lens for long shots and it was a little expense but worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for amateur photographer looking to take amazing photos!
Reviews.Author: K. Kendziora "Kory"
Reviews.Content: I am upgrading from the Nikon D40 and I found that the D5300 was very easy to use and it has the no flash feature which works great in lower light scenarios.  The stock lens is just right in size and ability to take your everyday shots.  I find that the feel of the camera is just right and I don't notice it being to bulky or too small for an SLR (The D40 seemed to be a bit small for my larger hands).The speed and quality of the shots form this camera are outstanding and I am very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: I found this camera by looking up best begginer DSLR cameras. This Nikon was on top so I went with the best. The settings are easy to learn for an extreme newbie like me or anyone starting. The lens (18-55mm) is great as well. Overall great camera I have in fact tried others but this one hit the spot even after the "best" review.

Reviews.Title: Good value for high quality filming
Reviews.Author: FilmPro
Reviews.Content: I've always been a Canon guy, but recently decided to try out Nikon. The D5200 has become a great,reliable backup camera for me. It's lightweight, takes high quality images and full HD video up to 60i which is great for moving images. There isn't much noise even at high ISOs. My only gripe is that it is harder to adjust settings using the buttons and scroll wheels, so you are forced to enter menus to make fine changes that could be more easily be done on my Canons.However, even for a main camera, not just a backup, I can still recommend the D5200.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie tter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to upgrade and I am so happy that I did. I am ready to get outside and use it even more.

Reviews.Title: As promised
Reviews.Author: Cole
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Bought "like new" and was pleasantly surprised. Couldn't even tell it had been used. Love the camera already and haven't even read the manual. Would recommend seller and camera!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for Photo. Not great for video.
Reviews.Author: Abhi gautam
Reviews.Content: After taking hundred of shots i am pleased with camera's performance. Photos are sharp and accurate. Not good enough for video recording as some of the frame goes out of focus, hens giving only 4 star. Apart from that it rocks.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Midastuch78
Reviews.Content: Out of the box this camera is very pretty. I was a bit surprised and panicked a little bit when I turned it on and the language was set to Japanese though. Luckily it was easy enough to find the language section and change it to English.Great camera and I have had so much fun taking pictures all over South Carolina.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5200 camera
Reviews.Author: Terrence Lindley "poetiq"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I bought a 55-200 mm lens and it is brilliant. Fumbling around only shooting in manual mode is fantastic, wonderful photos in low light.

Reviews.Title: The best of Nikon for entry level cameras
Reviews.Author: charles schwabacher
Reviews.Content: Ten times better than my N3000. Does more with less work. The 5200 is as good as the 5300 at a lower price and can do all a professional unit can except for very special apps.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Addict
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to get into the stats of this camera. There are many other reviews and websites that already have this information available.The Nikon D5200 is a nice camera. It has a swivel screen which is useful for video or weird camera angles. It has a lot of nice features, one of my favorites being all the auto-focus points and the low noise at high ISOs. The stock lens is perfect for a beginner. You can learn on the kit lens and still have quality pictures. You will want to upgrade eventually though.I think this camera is great for people who want to actually learn photography. If you're just going to shoot in Auto mode all the time, get a nice point and shoot and save yourself a lot of money. If you're actually interested in learning how to manually control your camera, then get a DSLR. The D3000 series (D3300 is most recent at the time I wrote this) is another great series by Nikon with a few less features. Also a great starter DSLR.

Reviews.Title: GREAT body
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Vilches
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera, I had the D40, D3200, D5100 and this one is by far the best of all, a great improvement from the D5100 and extreamly fast

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5200
Reviews.Author: Victoria A.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my camera! It has many features and love how my pictures come out! I am very satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: Small, but very powerful!
Reviews.Author: Gabriel
Reviews.Content: I got this camera refurbished, and it works perfectly!  I also have use an older Nikon D80.  Compared to the d80 (should apply to the new D7000/7100 too), the D5200 feels more "plasticky" and hollow.  Performance-wise, the camera is remarkable.  It's definitely the one to beat for a while.  Both photos and videos look beautiful, and the screen interface is simple and a treat to look at.  Raw files can get a little large, though (~36mb), but with a good SD card, this shouldn't be much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: Landscape, Wildlife Photogragher
Reviews.Author: Jack M Seaman
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a short time this winter. So far I am very satisfied with the layout of the controls, the light weight of the camera and quality photo's I have taken so far. As the weather gets better and I use the camera more I might be able to rate it higher.I traded my D3200 for this camera and I believe the D5200 turns on faster and is much easier to focus under some conditions.I would say you can't hardly go wrong with this camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5200 with (kit) 28-55mm zoom lens
Reviews.Author: Alfred T.
Reviews.Content: This camera has many features of the Nikon D7000 professional model for roughly half the price. Using good lenses, and a good photo editor I seriously doubt anyone on the planet could tell the difference.

Reviews.Title: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: Toya
Reviews.Content: Amazing. I love this camera. The quality it's beyond what I expected. I couldn't be happier with my new camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Sharolyn Sievert
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before getting this camera.  I am a volunteer search & rescue K-9 handler and needed a camera that could take action photos of working dogs.  This does that and much more.  It has way more options that I anticipated and am still learning to use, but so far am very impressed with the photos I've taken.  Great service, received as expected!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Wes
Reviews.Content: I will not pretend I know anything at all about a good camera. We use this to take pictures of our family and nature. Our lives. It is a beautiful camera. Some of the best images we have ever seen have come out of this camera. It has an amazingly fast shutter. You can edit your picture right on the camera. I would buy it again if I needed another. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: The adjustable live view monitor is great.
Reviews.Author: DeeCee "Western fan"
Reviews.Content: While I normally use the view finder, the live view monitor is great for taking pictures if I'm too short or I don't want to crawl in the mud.  I can turn the monitor to a position where I can remain standing and still frame the picture.  This is my second Nikon and I'm glad I upgraded to the D5200.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: VooDoo "VooDoo"
Reviews.Content: Camera takes nice clear bright photos.  Easy to use.  This is a nice entry level camera to the SLR market.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Champ Jones
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a middle of the road camera when it comes to budget, This is hands down one of the best options out thereRidiculous quality on photos and videos, I did some research on every different type of camera and the dslr type cant be matched when it comes to delivering quality in this price range(this is my opinion)Only negative with this camera would be the power drainage it suffers when shooting high quality video, as well as the mic, the mic in the camera is cell phone like, this didn't disappoint me because the quality of everything else greatSo I recommend getting an extra battery and an external mic if you want to shoot videosAlso the Rokinon 85mm f/1.4 lens should be one of the first lenses you get, incredible lens, the nikons 35mm and 50mm dont seem to match its sharpness

Reviews.Title: nikon 5200
Reviews.Author: Veniamin Kalmanovich
Reviews.Content: exellent camera.I bought it refurbished but it looks and feels like brend spanking new.takes exellent pictures and I really like quality of the video.

Reviews.Title: Purchase of my Nikon
Reviews.Author: Marcelo Mastrostefano
Reviews.Content: I choose it because of some advice of my friendsIt was really a good productI recomend it to any ho wants to buy an SLR camera

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: So far I love everything about this camera. It is a fabulous intermediate camera. It has so many features of the higher end professional models and the ones that it does not have I would never use anyways.I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: MLAM
Reviews.Content: This camera performs really well, takes really great pics and the videos are super clear too. I highly recommend this camera and this lens to go with it - 70-300 F4.5-5.6 G ED-INTERNAL FOCUS AF-S VR. I bought the lens used for under $400. The two together are amazing!

Reviews.Title: Great step up from D5100
Reviews.Author: blitz2010
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! It has replaced my D5100.  I love how clear the images are and there are 39 focus points, which is great!

Reviews.Title: almost as good as the d300s
Reviews.Author: All ammo
Reviews.Content: I have own the d3200 and now the d5200 which I returned and exchanged.  I first thought the D3200 was awesome until I have taking pictures with the D5200.. auto focus is very fast and very accurate.  One day I had my friend over with his D300s,  We did a comparison test with his beast 24-70 f2.8 and my prime 35mm f1.8. we took pictures with both cameras on both lenses, both on identical  manual settings.  The D5200's pictures are brighter and more crisp and detailed when zoomed in.. I guess is because it has more megapixels.  I will not say the D5200 is better than D300s.  The D300s is much faster in almost everything and it also have auto focus motor build it and magnesium body.  I would suggest get just the body and the 18-200mm vrII since now is $250.00 off with the camera.

Reviews.Title: BEST Bang for your Buck.. I got the sweetest deal ;)
Reviews.Author: jog3ee
Reviews.Content: Well this is a GREAT camera and you know what's even better? I got a GREAT price on it :D The body + 18-55mm VR kit lens cost me 700$ in my home country instead of 896$ here at Amazon; now isn't that SWEEET.About the camera, I'm new to DSLR photography and took a kind of uncertain leap from Canon to Nikon. I was very happy with my Canon T3i, my 1st DSLR but I am GLAD that I switched to this baby ;)!! In addition to the kit lens I added a 50mm 1.8g lens and Its a package that covers most of my basic photography needs.The performance, the auto-focus, the result, low light performance, and a massive 24 mega pixels give me enough room to crop/edit and still retain great image quality. I'm not much into movies but the movies are sharp and give great low light results as well. The AF in movie mode is something Im getting used to of of and in my opinion not better than the Canon t4i AF but still does a great job and the movie quality is quite superior to that of t4i, or even t5i maybe as that camera is almost identical to caonon t4i except some minor changes.If you're new to DSLRs, get this camera. You wont regret it and it offers quite a lot compared to similarly priced peers.

Reviews.Title: Best value
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Positive- good auto focus- good pictures in all light conditions, that's the reason to buy it, also for the video as well- shoots great video!!!- great flashNegative- weird skin tones color sometimes. I shot canon, Nikon, Olympus and Fuji; some I own and some I rented and when I compared photos, there is something about d5200 skin tones that bugged me. I got some very good pictures with d5200, but a good number of them I would not put in my photo album because of skin tones.Yes, I would recommend this camera easily because this is all around great performer with a very good video. A lot of cameras shoot great under certain light conditions, d5200 handles it all without any problems, i just wish skin colors are a little better.

Reviews.Title: Good but
Reviews.Author: Ms Susan F. Robbiano "xxxxxxx"
Reviews.Content: Nice pics but the sports mode turns off the flash so if u want flash u need to buy extra flash attachment

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Skinoze
Reviews.Content: It will probably take me a year to master all the functions but I'm completely satisfied with this camera. Excellent value for the money!!

Reviews.Title: Very inpresed
Reviews.Author: John M. Russell
Reviews.Content: I have a d5100 and struggled to decide on getting a d5200 or D600 for a second body.  With the price weight and oil spot problems with the D-600 the D-5200 won.  I couldn't be happier.  The new features like time-lapse, the WU-1a and a little faster shutter are nice upgrade.  One thing you need the fastest memory card you can afford especially if shooting raw or (and jpeg) for it to keep up Extreme SDXC UHS-I card 45MB's a minimum. Extreme Pro SDXC UHS-I 95 MB's even better but it will set you back $70 to $140 respectively.  The D-600 is still in the future but I am very happy for now.

Reviews.Title: Too Many Important Functions Hidden in Menus
Reviews.Author: Know What I Mean?  Nudge Nudge "NH AV Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice quality effort from Nikon.  The 5200 has a good feature set, and takes nice quality pics, but I found that far too many functions I use on a regular basis were buried in the menus.  That was the deal killer for me.  I read reviews about this, but I want to make people aware that this is much more of a pain in the bum than you think.  Fix this issue Nikon, and you have a Canon killer on your hands!

Reviews.Title: Beyond expectation
Reviews.Author: Miha Ahronovitz "myinnervoice"
Reviews.Content: Our six year G9 Canon camera had a failure too expensive to fix.So we decided replace it.  I considered the new Nikon Coolpix 600. It has no RAW mode and no socket for an external flash, I looked at Canon SX-50. Based on my G9 Canon experience, this is quite complicated to operate. The UI of cameras seems to not make much progress compared to cell phones.Nikon D3200  as an SLR camera,. Because the new model D3300 came out, the D3200's price is suddenly  closer to the long zoom point and shoot. The camera is very light and all commands are intuitive. We added a WiFi access via WU-1a Nikon accessory.The Nikon D5200. I has a rotating display,  so one can take a "selfie" It has more pre-set shooting programs and a better focusing system. I could not resist the temptation so we got the Nikon 5200 instead of 3200.The clarity and color of the photos is astonishing. Compared to my Canon 7D, this camera weights almost half. We bought it in red, which looks like a modern art piece in a modern art museum..The price of Nikon D5200 compared to what it offers is a steal. Simply out of the box, If you are real beginner, the camera takes pictures in only two setting; automatic, and automatic no flashThen slowly, you can learn more features as the camera smoothly invites you to try from its sheer simplicity that seems to say "you can do it".

Reviews.Title: My camera
Reviews.Author: Cecilia Fernández Costa
Reviews.Content: I wanted that specific camera, because I was tryining it (with a friend's similar camera). After 2 days reading the manual and proving the functionalities, I can say I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: My First DSLR
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I have not used an SLR (Pentax K1000) since i started having problems finding film and developers. I began using my phone to take pictures but they were not exactly what i wanted each time, i kept missing the ability to backlight and change the aperture to increase the focus range. The D5200 has been great, i have been taking much sharper pictures and i continue to play with the manual mode to perfect my shot. What is best now is that i can bracket my pictures without wasting 3 or 4 frames of film. As a new comer to DSLRs i cannot give a great comparison to other cameras on the market, but i can say that this camera did not have a steep learning curve due to the scenes mode and i was impressing people with my first shots. I love the manual, aperture and shutter speed priority and the ability to set the ISO (equivalent) has been great. My only con is that the lenses are much more expensive than i remember from the 90's.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: As I  have been playing with this camera recently, i absolutely love it. It's small, compact, it has 14 bit raw, The same focusing system as the d7000 the filters aren't much use to me but to a consumer photographer they should be fun, the only two complaints I have and they aren't really complaints are, that the light meter seems to slightly over expose but that's not hard to fix, as well as the camera it's self has no motor in it for autofocusing and the lens has to. These are the only complaints I have and I definitely recommend this dslr to any beginner and itWould definitely serve to many wedding photographers and land scape photographers

Reviews.Title: D5200
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Mabry Jr. "K.Mabry"
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed the purchase of my Nikon D5200, while I'm still learning to use the camera and all it can do, I'm very pleased with the performance. I enjoy the feel of this camera in my hands and have used it on many all day events with great captures.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kenton Filipowicz
Reviews.Content: I love the images and I love the video quality. First time dslr user and I'm a video producer. DSLR's are a little hard to pick up and start using but I'm getting the hang of it. Great camera all around though.

Reviews.Title: This camera is simply a beast and Nikon rocks.
Reviews.Author: james gomes
Reviews.Content: Amazing Camera takes stunning pictures I replaced my canon dos 20d with this camera, I was planing on buying another camera but I chose this instead and I am very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love the photos ..
Reviews.Author: Michael John Wittman
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional but I'm very happy with the quality and features of this camera.  Some features are hard to find on the menu system but it gets easier as you become familiar with the layout.  Video is superb as well.  Plus this camera is VERY fast .. you won't miss any shots for lack of camera speed.  In the past I've not used special "scene modes" since I know enough about photography that I didn't feel I needed it;  but this camera has such wonderful "on-camera" photo augmentation I highly recommend experimenting with the "built-in" photo enhancements.

Reviews.Title: Continues to impress
Reviews.Author: J. Sambataro
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from my Nikon D200 to the D5200 and have been especially enjoying the new camera with the Nikon 16-85mm lens. The sensor is amazing and especially helps for low light; the in-camera HDR works pretty well and can even be done without a tripod with a steady hand; I like how easy it is to toggle between video and still shots; you can even cut new start and end points on the camera to save memory on both your card and computer; and I like how you can either shoot through the viewfinder, use the screen for shot info, or in screen view. I was going back and forth between this and the D7000 and I selected a lighter, smaller camera body with the newer sensor, pixel size, toggle screen, easy video shooting over the durability, weather proofing of the D7000. Here are a few notes to keep in mind:-lens such as a simple 50mm without a motor built in will not autofocus on the D5200 (no in-camera motor). However, I found that using my f1.8 50mm indoors for a party was worth the manual focusing.-battery life of the en-el14 is really short -especially if you use the screen view. Always have a fully charged 2nd battery. If you are in the backcountry for a while without a solar charger, consider a 3rd battery.-one thing i miss is how easy it was on the d200 to toggle around your focal point. This is still possible but I can only figure out how to do that in screen view mode.That's all for now, still more to learn and I can't wait to test its full potential.

Reviews.Author: Neel

} } } Length:: 0:51 MinsThe Nikon D5200 has several great features that other customers have taken the time to point out. It has good quality control, the ability to take very high resolution photos, a compact and relatively lightweight design, compatibility with many lenses, and many functions that are designed to improve photo quality in different settings.However, I noticed a major flaw that is highlighted in the attached video. There is a constant sound that comes from the camera in every video one shoots with it. In my video, I have quelled the sound significantly using some software. However, even after all of this effort, the sound is still present and can be heard alongside the crashing waves. This is a major flaw that causes the D5200's video quality to be considerably sub-par.I would like to stress that visually, all the images and videos have excellent quality. However, sound is a necessary component to a video.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the $
Reviews.Author: AZazel
Reviews.Content: Just upgraded from a D5100 and could not be happier. The D5100 was\is a good camera BUT the D5200 has those few extra things (bells and whistles) that I had been wishing the D5100 had.  I took a couple dozen shots within minutes of getting the camera and I am very pleased with the results.  Looking forward to learning how to properly use all the abilities this camera capable of.Relatively light-weight and easy to hold with the 18-55mm lens. No P.h.d. needed to operate but some level of photography knowledge will help you use this camera to it's full potential.  If you want a more "point & shoot" type DSLR look at the D3200.Sadly tho Amazon's packaging left more than a little to be desired. The units box was loose within Amazon's shipping container.  It was able to move\slide 3-5" in most directions and that made me very nervous as it came thru the USPS, a group not renowned or known for it's careful handling of packages.Luckly there was no damage, just a dented outer box (shipping container). Note to Amazon:  If I'm spending over $900.00 with you I do expect better packaging.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievably Versatile
Reviews.Author: Salvatore Mansu
Reviews.Content: Wow! there is nothing this camera won't do. What makes it so nice is how intuitive it is.  The learning curve was very short but most important, I have never had my photos come out so good.  Every day I learn more about the camera and every day my photography gets better.

Reviews.Title: Beginner
Reviews.Author: P. Soto
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this camera.  I had been learning about photography for only 6 months with a Canon and was very scared to try a Nikon because they just seem too complex.  After spending a little time with my new Nikon D5200, it was easy to learn and operate. I have been shooting in raw and the pictures are just crystal clear.  It has so many features that I can't wait to explore.  It is lightweight and the red color is beautiful. The software is also easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Martinez
Reviews.Content: I love the 24.1 MP since that lets me crop images ( arrange composition ) without loosing details.The body feels strong.Since I was using a Cannon Camera before, It took me a while to get used to Nikon's navigation controls ( I still think that on this part Cannon cameras are easier to use ).Continuous shooting is superb on this camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Bebow "APB"
Reviews.Content: I've had this for almost 2 months and am in my second photography class with it and just love it.  I researched many cameras and am so happy that I chose to go with this one.  Many people in the class have wished their cameras included the top notch features that this camera has.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Sergio Augusto
Reviews.Content: I have been taking pictures for a while. I find this camera faster than may old D3100: it focus faster. I have been having sharper pictures. It also takes more pictures one after the other faster and with better quality.I feel my photos are with better colors and sharpness. Has also nice effects like keeping one subject in color and rest in black and white. I will test other features like filming and then report later. So far, I think it was worth the extra money from D3100.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Steve V
Reviews.Content: I've owned a DSLR camera for many years and I've always just used it in the fully automatic mode.  I decided to get more serious about photography, so I upgraded from my old early model Sony to this camera.  I now shoot all my photos in either "M" mode or "A" mode and my photos turn out much better.  With the way the digital display is laid out on this camera made it much easier for me to scan through all my settings which is really nice when you're not an experienced photographer. I'm definitely glad I bought this camera.

Reviews.Title: Damage camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Bertoni
Reviews.Content: This item was bought to be deliver internationally.As I received it, it was damaged. Its not working.Looks perfect, but does not work.How could we do in order to exchange it for one that functions.Please advise to this mail: bert@grupo-gerencial.comThanks in advance.

Reviews.Title: The best toy!
Reviews.Author: eAragon
Reviews.Content: Nice!! The best toy for take pics! Like a porfessional tool is excelent for many situations. Resistant body and very good quality.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5200
Reviews.Author: Bill F
Reviews.Content: I have only owned this camera for about a month now. It does everything as advertised.The only things I would mention to people upgrading to a dslr would be that the D5200 autofocusis built into the lens. Where as if you spend a couple hundred dollars more the autofocus systemis built into the camera. With the latter type camera you can use older lenses.The other thing worth mentioning is other than the shutter setting you need to push and hold down a button andthen rotate the setting wheel to change your ISO and aperture settings. This can become challenging whenlooking through the view finder.For the price, if you are on a budget you can't go wrong with this camera. The bottom line is the actual picture andthe D5200 takes an awesome picture!

Reviews.Title: D5200 nikon
Reviews.Author: Mary Maloney
Reviews.Content: I signed up for a photography class that required a camera with changable lens. After doing some research the D5200 was highly recommended for what I needed.  I bough it under used but it was new and in the box. I received it on time, in fact a day early.  I have really enjoyed the camera and hope that I will know what all the bells and whistles will do.

Reviews.Title: Great next level entry DSLR
Reviews.Author: Joe Cool
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR, moving up from a fully programmable Fuji point and shoot.  While i used the settings on the Fuji (aperture, exposure etc.)  It just didn't have the speed.  This certainly does & is very easy to use.  Spend a couple bucks and get a good zoom, the 18-55 is nice but not nearly enough zoom.

Reviews.Title: Arrived earlier than expected in excellent condition!!++++
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the prompt service, I will definitely be ordering form you again in the future, everything was as advertised, and in great condition. Very well packaged and arrived way earlier than i thought! Thanks again!My previous camera was a D90, and this is definitely a step above! i would highly recommend it to anyone looking to upgrade!

Reviews.Title: excellent!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jacopo
Reviews.Content: the camera was sold as described. It was new and the shutter count was zero, so no picture were taken. Perfect conditions.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with great features!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Everley
Reviews.Content: Great camera! It takes a little while to get used to if you've never had a DSLR before, but once you get the hang of it you can really get professional quality photos with it (especially shot in RAW format). The lens is a bit limiting but is good for the range it was made for.

Reviews.Title: Great transaction
Reviews.Author: Kevin Q
Reviews.Content: Product arrived promptly with everything in order - hassle free:-)  I would order from this reseller again.  The D5200 is great for my Prosumer son that is studying film  in college,

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: 3E
Reviews.Content: I have no issues with this product. But it's my 1st SLR camera so I don't really have anything to compare it to. It takes good photos which I expected.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: This is just a very nice camera--it has a high quality MP and is very easy to use--but very difficult to master!  Came exactly as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the camera that long but so far I am loving it!  This is my first step in the SLR world and overall it has been an easy transition from a point and shoot.  I have only used the manual settings a few times but i'm learning more and more each day.  Even when using automatic settings the pictures turn out beautifully.

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camera
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Lisi
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what i wanted :). It's a very nice camera the pictures are too clear and the lens is versatile.

Reviews.Title: Nikon is clearly a great product
Reviews.Author: RISA I CAPOBIANCO
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my daughter who is a somewhat experienced photographer. This was her first real pro slr so I didn't want it to lack in options at the same time be so heavy she couldn't hold it.  It delivered on all levels.  The 18-140 lens was a good choice because she can go effortlessly from one shot to the next.  Took some great photos and blew them up to frame. Beautiful color and clarity.  She can upgrade with more lenses when she is ready.  I fell i made a good choice.  A combination of ease of use and quality.

Reviews.Title: Learning as we go
Reviews.Author: S. Casey "caverugger"
Reviews.Content: Like others, we finally made the leap to a SLR. This is an intermediate choice, with a sophisticated and robust processor. There is a great review by "Faymous Media" that provides a nice video of the capabilities and specs. It helped tipped scales in favor of this model over the 3000 series, and over comparable Canon models. We are very happy with the photo quality, excellent frames per second, and depth of options.After a month of playing, we are beginning to get an understanding of how to use the vast range of the D5200 capabilities.  We are now shopping for other lens varieties for other types of photos, both long distance and ultra-wide. We highly recommend the WU-1a adapter if you have an iPad or iPhone.  With that you don't need to bother with buying the remote shutter. It also allows quick views and wireless copying of photos already on the SD card.

Reviews.Title: Just the right amount of features for a beginner who wants to do almost everything the big boys can do.
Reviews.Author: Randall
Reviews.Content: This is one hell of a step up from taking pictures with my cellphone.  I'm still learning and this camera has the power to let me practice what I learn.

Reviews.Title: My best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Brian Will
Reviews.Content: It's light!It's fast!It's the best low light performing camera I ever had!You cannot beat the price!I love it!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: D. Shaw "Oh meow"
Reviews.Content: Nikon D5200 is very nice camera that have variable angle LCD much easier to use than D3100, D 3200, D600 and D7100, etc. which are fixed LCD.

Reviews.Title: Much improvement!
Reviews.Author: KNovo
Reviews.Content: This is a bigger improvement than the Nikon D5000. The megapixels are outstanding and so are the manual settings. The automatic can be screwy sometimes in the sense of the autofocus. That is the only downfall for this camera. The camera is user friendly.

Reviews.Title: YES!
Reviews.Author: Darrell French
Reviews.Content: Definitely has helped me a lot. I'm thinking about stepping up to the D7000 now that i'm learning how to use the camera a bit more.

Reviews.Title: execllent
Reviews.Author: gordon k.
Reviews.Content: Great camera for ease of use and manual setting easy to read on screen.  View finder is large and easy to see display.

Reviews.Title: Fast and Furious!
Reviews.Author: M. E. Cosentino
Reviews.Content: Very nice product, I'm upgrading from a Nikon D3100, and the new features are amazing. Still a lot to learn about photography, but I confidence that Nikon D5200 will help me.

Reviews.Title: Huge back focus issue
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: There is a huge backfocus issue with this camera. Same this happened for D7000. If you are looking into advanced-beginners photography try to avoid this. Lot of users are having the same issues [...] I contacted Nikon Support and they said I have to pay to fix it, even though I have 1 year warranty, since its a mirror issue.

Reviews.Title: But
Reviews.Author: A. Barnes
Reviews.Content: The camera is great but I went to Tall's and it was on sale for 300 less than what I paid and it came with two kit lens boy was I upset and the one I have wasn't even brand new.

Reviews.Title: Really useful features of SLR camera
Reviews.Author: Rahul Mani
Reviews.Content: Worth going for the midrange than the Nikon D3200. Love the pullout feature of the LCD and the manual features

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Leslie Olson
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures! It is user friendly and the menu is easy to understand. The video is a little challenging to use.

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Mario Esparza
Reviews.Content: From a 35mm camera that I had for many years?, jumped into this camera! I love. It very much!!Made the right choice

Reviews.Title: i fell in love
Reviews.Author: jonathon mcadam
Reviews.Content: I have used a nikon d5100 for awile and finally decided I wanted more mega pixels. The layout is awesome and I love my new camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera and has been a great upgrade from my old Nikon D40x. Picture quality is wonderful, focus is quick and responsive. Would be really good camera for novice or more advanced users.

Reviews.Title: Now I am very disappointed
Reviews.Author: STRAJ
Reviews.Content: When I got this camera, I wrote a very positive review. Had only good things to say.Unfortunately after 2 months of use, I have a problem. I was about to shoot pictures and after I turned it ON, I get the following error message: Error: Press shutter release button again.I went researching this issue and I see this is a common problem in the various nikon camera series. So, buyers please beware.

Reviews.Title: good but lacks phase detection in liveview and touchscreen
Reviews.Author: A reader
Reviews.Content: This camera produces great pictures and works well overall if you do not have specific needs. Two main issues if the autofocus system is very important for your purchase1- AF is really better than cameras like the EM5 only if you shoot via the viewfinder instead of looking at the screen (liveview). In liveview the AF does not use phase detection so focusing on moving things will be more a hit and miss like in all M4/3 cameras.2- the 39 point focus system is great if autofocus is able to know where you want to focus...otherwise you may have to move the focus point manually and this may take time with 39 points, especially if you want to move across the focus area. A touch screen would have been a perfect means to solve this issue

Reviews.Title: Defective or not par with 5100. Test yours within 30 days.
Reviews.Author: vj
Reviews.Content: I own a D5100 and 50 mm 1.8 G, absolutely  love every picture 5100 takes,the pictures are sharp in focus points.Recently i upgraded to 5200 thinking it will improve low light image capturing and better pictures and more focus points. But I was wrong, 5200 cannot produce sharp image with any lens i own (Kit lens, 50mm and 55-300). The picture is not sharp even at focus points regardless of settings. The images seems like taken from compact cam.Its my fault that I didn't test this camera within 30 days. I think mine is faulty but not sure.With Nikon warranty you have to have pay shipping cost for repair, so I would recommend everyone to test you cam within 30 days or you have go through all frustration and "copy paste" response from Nikon customer care (seriously irritating).1 start for Nikon and when the camera is repaired , i'll test and provide stars.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, got the red D5200 for my wife and it is sharp
Reviews.Author: James E.
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, shipped fast, pictures are very clear. Wife was using the Nikon D90 and these pictures are better. She loves to take cross country and track photos and this seems to be it.

Reviews.Title: Compact and sharp
Reviews.Author: M. Winchester
Reviews.Content: I only had this camera for a short time (had to get the D7100 for its' more advanced features). But I felt it's metering was very good, the AF system offered much more flexibility than the D3200 I had been using and the 24mp was useful to me, allowing some cropping flexibility in post, if I needed it. I also liked how light it was - very convenient for day hikes.

Reviews.Title: from d3200 to d5200
Reviews.Author: Kenneth E. Epperson "Kenneth E. Epperson"
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased the d3200, after having it for a couple weeks found it just didnt have all the features I needed. What was an even bigger surprise was when I returne the d3200 for the d5200, not only did it have a lot more features that I needed, but seemed to me to be a totally differnt camera in several respects. I would say if you are looking for a first time dslr shooter, the d3200 might be a goid place to start, but if you have already owned any dslr before, do yourself  a favor and move up the the d5200 from the beginning, you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 5200
Reviews.Author: b105984
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my  son and daughter-in-law.  The price was very excellent and they have used it since Christmas and are very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for advanced non-professional
Reviews.Author: DMB in NC
Reviews.Content: Have had a great time with this camera since its arrival. Just got back from Charleston, SC which is a photographer's paradise, and the shots that I have examined so far are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great improvement on my little point & shoot
Reviews.Author: Madricucho
Reviews.Content: Great improvement on my little point a shoot, still getting a hand on basic funtionality. Experimenting on Shutter and Aperture mode and raw format. Do not forget to by an extra battery and high capacity SD cards, I promess and update on this review when I get back from vacation .

Reviews.Title: Great value with many useful features. Very satisfied with the initial evaluation.
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Drisgill
Reviews.Content: I first read the D5200 technical specs, features, and user reviews on Amazon prior to purchasing. Received the new camera with the 18mm to 105mm lens about two weeks ago.  Have taken some marvelous images while at Bayou La Batre, Al. and also at Bok Tower Gardens, Fl.  Still experimenting with the multiple settings and shooting modes.  So far, all images are at least as good as expected.  The D5200 with this lens is not too heavy, and has good balance. Menu's are easy to understand and to select modes to enhance shooting effects.This new dSLR was an upgrade from my Canon SX10is, Minolta d-Image 7, and still holding on to my film cameras Pentax 35mm SLR and Mamiya C330 twin lens reflex medium format.  The last two make good conversation pieces.

Reviews.Title: Not like my D40X
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: I am kind of disappointed with this camera.  My D40X was fabulous....great pics and easy to use.  Until my granddaughter drowned it in the Atlantic Ocean this summer.  Don't get me wrong.....this is easy to use, has a lot of fun features that my old camera didn't have, but I just don't feel that the quality of photo is there.  When I shoot outdoors, they are great, but my indoor pics are really making me crazy.  Lighting very different from the D40X, and when I try to shoot scrapbook pages, I can't seem to square them up like I could with the D40X.  I will have to work with it, for the price I  paid, but I'm not truly happy with it and wish that I wasn't so glued to the Nikon name----should have looked at other brands before buying!

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: manuel
Reviews.Content: like the functions, speed and image qualityalso the new quick settings are just perfect for family picturesthis weekend will go to the mountains and test it

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures out of the box
Reviews.Author: Faust5
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR, so I'm unfamiliar with most of the details of the device. However, just for taking pictures as though it were a point-and-shoot, the pictures are fantastic. I'll update this review as I figure out my product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Brasewel Noronha
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to learn photography and boy was I impressed. It's incredibly easy to learn and use and I have taken some fantastic photos. It's got all the features you would need as an amateur photographer and more. Additionally, it also takes great video.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5200 is excellent camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: J. Sykes "Photog"
Reviews.Content: Nikon D5200 24.1MP Digital SLR Camera is very well make and the image its product better too. The color and tone is perfect and high MP is good enough for any publication or advertising project. I highly recommended to pick up grip for the camera for people who have a big hand. Video with continue autofocus with the Nikon lens is better than ever. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: arlene e. santana
Reviews.Content: lightweight and versatile.  i would recommend it to anyone interested in a portable, but powerful slr nikon camera.  love it.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded to full frame
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: It had a back focus problem, 70% of my vacation photos were out of focus :( My point & shoot camera is doing much better. Maybe that was because of the Sigma 17-50 lens - I returned that too.I went for Nikon D610 after that. Full frame gives you those dream/art pictures that you love to set as a background on your computer. APS-C format is not close to that.Go full frame!

Reviews.Title: Works great for video!
Reviews.Author: Tad Hathaway
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the video on this camera...didn't notice much difference between its video and the more expensive D600 or D800.  Here's some sample footage I shot in New Orleans during Super Bowl weekend.  [...]

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Jose J. Pena "East Side"
Reviews.Content: I love it, easy to use,I want it in a diferent color,thats why I ordere it in color red,everybody have the camera color black.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D5200 24.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR NIKKOR Zoom Lens (Black)
Reviews.Author: rcg
Reviews.Content: Nikon D5200 24.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR NIKKOR Zoom Lens (Black) very happy with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Nice comparing to Canon 650D
Reviews.Author: Patrick M,
Reviews.Content: 24mega pixels gives a lot more color depth and little less noise than the canon 650D (t4i). the 18-105mm lens gives it a lot more value over the 18-55mm.

Reviews.Title: A Different Take with (unfair) Comparison
Reviews.Author: Boogaloo
Reviews.Content: Four Stars for features and Three Stars for results.  My bundle featured the dove-tailing AF-S 18-55mm VR and 55-300mm VR lenses in a kit for my wife to keep her out of my Canon 60D bag that was kitted with Canon's 18-250mm IS. I'm not married to makes/models or I would not have bought this Nikon.  I don't get into the weeds on menu layouts, materials and other subjective items.  I rarely shoot video and offer no comments there.  This Nikon is otherwise a highly featured camera, especially with scene modes, making it nicely serviceable from new entrants to those who like full manual.  I very much like its very hi-res screen display.  My typical shooting is in the arena during Texas style barrel racing events demanding high shutter speeds and accurate tracking focus that freezes the dirt in mid-air.I shot the Nikon with its VR 18-55mm lens this morning side-by-side with the Canon 60D / 18-250mm knowing it is not an exact comparison; it's what I had available.  There are, however, reviews here extolling this Nikon over pro-sumer models, notably Canons.  The subject was flower blossoms and bees providing for both stationary and high speed shooting subjects.  The conditions were morning light with cloud cover shooting in Aperture, Shutter, Program and Macro modes with equivalent settings.  The 24MP Nikon operated well, but in NO WAY did it's bundled lenses compete with the 18MP 60D kit.The results were very much equivalent to my first DSLR ... a Rebel XT with Canon's earlier and much maligned 18-50mm EOS kit lens.  However, shooting with the Nikon VR 55-300mm lens was more satisfying.  It still doesn't match the Canon 60D combo, which comes at a $600-$800 price difference. I call it 'satisfactory'.  Its minimum focus distance is longer than Canon's 18-250 IS; about 5-6 ft.  If I could only buy a Nikon kit w/ one lens, the VR 55-300mm would be it, while searching for a different wide angle zoom.  At best, the VR 18-55mm might work well as a portrait lens when 'soft' is desired.  Overall, I cannot agree that this Nikon kit is the equivalent of higher end models. That said, it is otherwise so nicely feature laden that it could be the only camera you'll ever need when it is equipped with higher caliber lenses.I see nothing gained with a 24MP model over the Canon 60D 18MP, which produces sharper images as a kit shot for shot. The megapixel wars are over in this camera class.  It's the lens wars that matter ... hold on to your wallet for that!!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: David Nielson
Reviews.Content: Good buy. In great condition. Everything was included as described and the item was on time. 100% satisfied with this item

Reviews.Title: not a pro but I love using it
Reviews.Author: booboo
Reviews.Content: this camera is the best. although I've not use it to its full potential because I am an amateur. I took it to Europe this summer and took some amazing shots.

Reviews.Title: Nice pics, weighs a bit too much
Reviews.Author: Joe D
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pics, however it's not as light as I thought it would be. Make sure to get a wrap in vase it is dropped. Spend a little money on a bag as well.

Reviews.Title: That's what it stars
Reviews.Author: Vasily Nikiforoff
Reviews.Content: And I can because it's a nice camera and have a good zoom that's why I chose this camera or professionals for the shoes

Reviews.Title: nikon d5200 uncompressed video out
Reviews.Author: ickball
Reviews.Content: why does not anyone tell that the nikon d5200 has a clean uncompresed video out at the highest quality??that is sooo important,,you can now record to a field recorder like the atamos ninja at raw video out with HDMI clean video output..that was the only reason i got this camera,,and on ebay it was 600 dollars,,that is a scandle that this is being sold so cheap,,the video on this is professional quality as good as the 5dmark2 or 3 and higher quality camcorders,,this video is that good,,the color is amazing and the sensor out put to recorder you can edit uncompressed video.just an amazing camera.why are people not buying this camera??because it has a plastic body,,???yes,,yes uyes,,people are stuck on looks just like everything else they deside on,,,well good,,that means i get to have a professional quality video camera for cheeeeeap...keep not buying the overpriced consumer stuff  cameras so i can pick the good stuff up,,,keep buying the more expensive with less quality,,,,go americans,,,,,idiots.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: MLight
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for my D3000.  I'm certainly not disappointed. It is everything that has been advertised and reviewed. The only thing I dislike is the articulated arm for video. However, it does stay flush with the camera when in the correct position. To me, they could eliminate this feature on a DSLR. I've run through about 500 shots on this camera so far extremely pleased with the result. I've been so pleased that I've included some 8x10's in my portfolio. If you're a serious amateur or just starting a professional career, this is a great tool for your business.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing compared to real Nikon DSLRs
Reviews.Author: Survivor
Reviews.Content: Briefly, this camera has some amazing features.  The sensor gets a very high rating from DXO Mark, eclipsing the D7100.  The viewfinder is ok.  Not great.  The auto-focus in low light conditions is abysmal.  It is a very very slow camera in low light, or when put into high resolution JPEG/RAW recording mode.  When the camera is in live view mode, it slows to a crawl.  Don't expect this camera to capture action indoors under many circumstances.  The battery life is good, but you can't use the full range Nikon lenses and expect the camera to work its magic.  You need at least a G-class lens, I think, for the auto-focus to work.  A Nikon D lens will not auto-focus on this body.  The full-auto mode renders acceptable images, but it freely records at ISO 3200 indoors even in relatively well lit environments, which brings some unnecessary noise into the images.  I think there are less expensive point and shoot cameras that would do a better job overall.In sum, I bought this camera body because I wanted a lighter, more compact, DX format body with higher resolution and image quality than a D7000.  What a TOTAL disappointment.  If you're a beginner, don't buy this camera.  There are many better choices out there.Update: Nikon has replaced the D5200 with a D5300 as of this week.  Vindication of my assessment of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good PIctures, Poor Build, Dust Magnet
Reviews.Author: MattBianco
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from my seven year old, still-alive-and-kicking-and-taking-great-pictures, Sony A-100 with an 18-200 lens.Pros:- great image and color accuracy- fast zoom- many "effects" that can make picture taking more interesting- a great all purpose 18-200 F3.5 lens with the kit I purchased- high quality videosCons:- Dust gets in the camera somehow. I have requested a return. After three days, I had dust visible and not cleanable, in the viewfinder- Menues and UI are very complicated relative to Canon and Sony DSLRs- AE lock not always successful- Some effects take forever to set up, such as B&W; with some colors excluded, will take 1-3 minutes to set up.- Location of the video record button is close to the shutter button, except you cannot use the viewfinder to video, only the LCD screen, for video. Therefore, all you videos are bump as you search for the button which is located somewhere totally useless and difficult to feel/find.- not able to record videos in 16:9 aspect ratio when every TV made in the last five years is 16:9- poor battery life (I got less than a 100 clicks and 3 minutes of video after a 24 hour charge)- cheap plastic build, including flimsy battery door- Price -given this is a glorified point and shoot- too many pixels -just a data hog- not enough camera.I wish my old Sony A-100 would take videos, and that it had better pixel count and better color accuracy. It is a lot easier to use, easier to hold, has longer batter life and better built -this camera is entirely plastic. I have dropped the Sony on solid rock several times but it has not affected it in anyway. With the D5200 you just have sense that it has to be held and placed on a table like you handle a 2 week old baby.I decided after the first day that given the high picture quality, I would live and master the poor UI and awkward button location for the video, and treat it like a precious child. It would be a price for high quality photography. However, when dust penetrated the camera after three days, I could not accept such a quality issue.I fell for Nikon as several of my photographer friends swore by the brand. In all fairness, they are all full size DSLR users. A journalist working for a local paper however told me that he switched to Canon 5 years ago, after 30+ years of being a Nikon fan, and has never looked back.I think I will go back to Sony, this time to A77.  Just the magnesium alloy body on that model makes a difference to me, with picture quality that is comparable.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Nichada Thinoiwong
Reviews.Content: It's camera in my mind.I love nikon. I love color of camera. That's awesome for me. I will enjoy for my big picture.

Reviews.Title: minor refresh of the D5100
Reviews.Author: l2
Reviews.Content: The D5100 was a big improvement over the D5000. The D5200 is only a minor enhancement over the D5100, but at a much higher price. More AF points is an interesting change for some types of photos. More MP is rarely useful at this level. Stero mic on the camera isn't really important; use an external microphone if you care about sound quality. If you're thinking about a D5200, do yourself a favor and look at the Nikon D5100 also. You might find one for half the price (especially Nikon factory refurbished) and not notice any performance difference.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 5200
Reviews.Author: J. Cordero
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I just picked up this camera from Costco on Tuesday.  They had it in a bundle for $1050.00 until April 27th.  It included the body(obviously),  both 18-55 and 55-300mm lens, the wifi adapter, Nikon bag, and 16 mg memory card.  This is our first DSLR and everyone we talk to tells us how great of a deal it is so we just wanted to share it with everyone.

Reviews.Title: good

Reviews.Content: love the camera and everything about it just that when i received the camera the lens was damaged a bit....kinda found out after few months later when i took a massive amount of photo because i found a weird mark on all the same spots on every picture

Reviews.Content: the camera is not in good condition because the camera shutter does not work and it is impossible to take photos. I am very upset -100 far have not given me any solution yet.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, fast shipping......
Reviews.Author: Eaglelax36
Reviews.Content: I love the camera, takes great, clear pictures. The package came without any damage to the contents within. I have not had much time to reeally get deep into the camera and try out all of its features, but the camera is very simple to use. I recommend this camera for anyone who is wanting to upgrade from the traditional point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: excelente

Reviews.Content: Excelente camara, muy facil de usar efectos buenos y creativos. Los puntos de enfoques son muy utiles y ademas excelente resolucion. Recomendada 100%

Reviews.Title: Nikon DSLR D5200
Reviews.Author: Matt Bacharach
Reviews.Content: Read reviews for months before was available in the US. Worried about overseas suppliers. The camera is easy to use & takes great pics right out of the box. Can also use all my old Nikkor lenses - a bonus for sure

Reviews.Title: Amazingly awful
Reviews.Author: Hamid Moham
Reviews.Content: I've been used to the d3100 & I wanted a quicker, sharper body.  The d5200 I got I tried on my 70-300mm lens which I have used, with total satisfaction, for 3 years.The d5200 did not perform as I expected.  In fact the resolution & focusing mechanism was far inferior, compared to my old d3100.  I sent it back to the seller.  Thank you very much !!  I have no idea why others have a totally different experience.

Reviews.Title: Where is the battery!
Reviews.Author: M. Stephanie Kellerman
Reviews.Content: I know I ordered the body only as I already have other lenses so I didn't need a duplicate lens, but the battery for my D90 does not work with this camera.  I would have fully expected a battery with it.  To me that is part of the body!  Really irritated. I don't care if that page shows that others also ordered a battery with it.  That means "additional" battery to me.  My D90 came with a battery.  Why didn't this one.  This is a warning for those who want to buy this.  Now I have to hope to get a battery by Saturday.

Reviews.Title: Love it! Except for the Fixed Pattern Noise
Reviews.Author: A. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I don't take pictures. This is just my opinion as far as the video features are concerned. The D5200 with a fast lens is a real dream camera. That is until you look at your footage on a computer and see the fixed pattern noise. It appears at every ISO and makes it a real pain to pull any detail from the shadows. There are ways to deal with it using software but it's time consuming and not a lot of fun. So, if you're looking to use this camera for video you should keep this in mind. There are a lot of discussions about this problem and I can confirm that the issue is real and hard to overlook.I hope Nikon tries to address the problem. If they did then I would have nothing but wonderful things to say about this camera. It's a shame.

Reviews.Title: My Camera
Reviews.Author: Djon jaunes
Reviews.Content: I am a novice when it comes to cameras and I really am trying to learn, I picked this camera because it was red.  I have taken  a lot of pictures since I bought the D5200 and I was amazed at how nice they turned out.  I have recommended this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Not like a point n' shoot camera, better.
Reviews.Author: roaeja "Hey you!"
Reviews.Content: Using a DSL is allot different than a point-n-shoot camera. It's a different mentality and user experience.Think of the DSR as a platform, for different lenses. In order to take advantage of its full potential, you need different lenses to attach to the platform body.The point and shoot has those built in. But, once you attach the correct lens to a DSR, then its magic will come out. It is a very precise platform, when attached to the correct lens, where as a P'n'S is not.I send mine back...they are coming out with a d7100, with better specs."Nikon has revealed a new enthusiast-level flagship DX-format camera, the 24.1-megapixel Nikon D7100. The much-awaited update to the aging D7000 has a professional-level 51-point AF system, and continuous full resolution shooting at 6 fps. Notably, the camera also does away with the optical low pass filter - meaning it should be able to capture sharper detail than cameras with a similar resolution.The Nikon D7100 has been given a specially designed DX-format (APS-C) 24.1-megapixel CMOS sensor (so not the same one employed in the D5200) which doesn't use the traditional optical low pass (anti-aliasing) filter found in most cameras. Nikon says this means it can produce sharper images that make the most of its resolution ... and presumably the firm is confident users won't suffer (too much) in terms of moiré and aliasing artifacts.Autofocus is another area where Nikon has significantly improved the camera. The D7100 uses the Nikon Advanced Multi-CAM 3500DX autofocus sensor module, and employs the same algorithm used in the Nikon D4. This gives what Nikon describes as "professional-level performance" from the 51 focus points (15 cross-type sensors), including speedy subject acquisition, and phase-detection AF down to a minimum luminance of -2 EV (really dark conditions).Using an EXPEED 3 image processor, the new camera has an ISO sensitivity of 100-6400 (expandable to 25600) and can shoot full resolution images at a not-too-shabby 6 fps, though the buffer capacity is only good for six frames in full 14-bit RAW (or 33 frames in JPEG fine and large).Interestingly, Nikon has also introduced a new 1.3x crop function which crops images, giving an extra telephoto effect - and taking it to about double the 35mm-format focal length. This is likely to be welcomed by sports and wildlife shooters, who will also benefit from the way focus points cover a wider area of the cropped frame ... and the increase in continuous shooting speed, which goes up to 7 fps. Cropped images are 15.4 megapixelsOn the video side of things there's Full HD (1920 x 1080) recording at frame rates of up to 60i/50i and 30p/25p/24p. Dropping the resolution to 1280 x 720 gives users the option of 60p recording. Video recording can be based on the full DX-format or using the 1.3x crop (both in an aspect ratio of 16:9). While there's a stereo microphone, videographers will also be pleased to see an external microphone jack and headphone connector.There's a 3.2-inch LCD on the rear with 1,229k dots, while the 100 percent coverage optical viewfinder has been given an OLED display (for the information under the image) which is said to be very bright and have low power consumption.Measuring 5.3 x 4.2 x 3 inches (135.5 x 106.5 x 76 mm) and weighing 23.8 ounces (675 g) the D7100 features magnesium alloy top and rear covers in a durable body which is dust, weather and drop resistant. For those who prefer their cameras with a vertical grip, Nikon has also introduced the MB-D15, which adds the usual shutter-release button, AE/AF lock button, multi selector, and command dials. It can be powered either by six AA batteries or the standard D7100 batteryThough there's no built-in wireless capabilities, the Nikon D7100 is compatible with the optional WU-1a Mobile Adapter which allows users to transmit images wirelessly to an iOS or Android device, or to remotely control the camera.While the numbering of the Nikon D7100 shows it's an update to the D7000, it's also possibly the closest thing the D300s is going to get to a replacement. Nikon is choosing to refer to it as the "flagship of Nikon's DX-format HD-SLR lineup" and it's hard to see what the fabled D400 could add ... other than a larger full-metal body and faster continuous shooting with a bigger buffer.The Nikon D7100 will sell for US$1,200 body-only when it goes on sale in March, or $1,600 with the AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR kit lens."I mean for $300 more, why not get a better one?  Coming out soon!

Reviews.Title: The good and the bad
Reviews.Author: mongyaj "Panasonic ZS7"
Reviews.Content: I think I have a bad unit. It would not take a perfect picture as it come out blurry. 2 out of 10 would come out good. Back focusing problem and completely blurry. There is no way you can tune it. When recording in HD, the LCD would glitch and freezing the video when you play back. I will return it back for a refund and will get the D7100 to see if it worth another $600... Look for lower rating because you will be aware for the up coming problem it may occur with the D5200.

Reviews.Title: im soooooo happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for our anniversary because I take really good pictures, and my phone memory card is always full. I always act like I'm a photographer because my picture always look beautiful. Now I can be a real photographer AFTER I READ THE MANUAL AND FIGURE MOST FEATURES OUT. This is the first product that I ever had to read the manual fo. This camera has it all. The effects are mind blowing, it focuses on one thng and blurs the back ground. It zooms and it has a flash light built in for taking picture in the pitch dark. Omg I'm melting with excitement. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: Nikon or cannon?
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey m Snyder
Reviews.Content: Who knows. I've been on an extended trip out west and I got to tell you people have cannons about 8 to 1.  Might mean something other than good marketing?  My camera seems ok. I'm just learning how to use it still, but can't say anything too negative about it

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Adam Mueller
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the beginners and the experienced photographers. I love canon but i tried the nikon and it is great. I use it from time to time but nothing compares to a canon.

Reviews.Title: missing accessories, someone else's memory card
Reviews.Author: jay
Reviews.Content: it's a great camera.  the reviews are spot on.i'm just not sure how mine arrived in this condition.  it was missing a DK-5 Eyepiece Cap, the AN-DC3 Camera Strap, and the EG-CP16 Audio Video Cable.  But it came with a 2gb memory card, loaded up with someone's trip to DC taken with a D50.I can't easily contact Amazon about this.  My only option is to send it back, which I really don't want to bother with-- I want to use the camera.  Anyway, bummer Amazon.  I'm not sure how you did this, but you sent me a screwed up D5200.And if i tried to buy the accessories from you, it would cost me $28.44. No thanks!

Reviews.Title: THe D5200 is just OK, but not great.
Reviews.Author: CyberCat
Reviews.Content: After using a D 200 and several point and shoot cameras, I wanted to "upgrade". The D5200 is a nice camera, but not a great camera and certainly produces no better pictures that a good point and shoot camera in side by side comparison , shooting the same scene in close sequence. Despite the multi point focusing, the pictures all show only a clear central area , while the periphery is uniformly out of focus. close up pictures are all black and not useable. Even in bright sunshine, the camera requires the flash about 40 per cent of the time. The D5200 is comfortable to hold and carry.  Overall, for general photography, i.e., family , sports and outdoor scenes, I would not find a reason to spend the money for this camera .

Reviews.Title: only takes nikon AF-S AF-1 lenses
Reviews.Author: rb maui
Reviews.Content: I Just received the D5200 and found it does not work with any  of my off brand lenses. It will only auto-focus with the proprietary Nikon AF-S and expensive Nikon  AF-1 lenses. I'm disappointed that I can't auto-focus with my new Tokina AF100-400mm. My D 200 works with just about every lens. The D-200 has an interior motor and the D-5200 apparently rely s on the lenses motor.
